content.description: Start on SE corner and continue directly upwards on far left side of east face.
Face and chimney on the left side of south face.

climbs.name: It Ain't Over til It's Over

content.description: Move up and a bit left on nice edges between the two overhangs that guard the ends of this block.
content.protection: Standard Blue Mounds set-up.  Long slings are useful.  Access via the gully to the left of this route.
content.location: Climbs the obvious east face about 40 feet left (south) of Elm Tree Pinch.

content.description: Up the center of the east face to a difficult roof with a thin crack.

This route has a couple of things going against it, the base is fully vegetated with typically nasty plants, the top is covered in cactus, and there is a wall behind the climb which detracts the the climb aesthetically...that being said.    The climbing on this route is TERRIFIC! Really fun liebacking leads to a unique roof with a mono pocket (yes a mono pocket at blue mounds!)    Steep and Fun!
content.protection: TR, might want a helmet if you plan on falling into the wall behind you.
content.location: This route is on Hidden buttress about 8 ft right of the hidden direct. Bushwack your way uphill from the acute corner. This climb has several trees at the base which must be climbed through.

content.description: face and OW on right side of south face.
Climb the south facing panel immediately left of Elm Tree Pinch on nicely spaced edges and horizontal breaks.
content.protection: Standard Blue Mounds toprope set-up.  Long slings helpful.  This route can be led with small to medium cams in the horizontal breaks.  Small to medium nuts could also be used.
content.location: Start immediately left of the crack system on Elm Tree Pinch.

content.description: Top is covered in cactus, bottom in thorny vines...
